1 JEE–MAIN EXAMINATION – APRIL 2025 PHYSICS TEST PAPER WITH SOLUTION  (HELD ON TUESDAY 08
th APRIL 2025) TIME : 3:00 PM TO 6:00 PM SECTION-A 26. Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R Assertion A : Work done in moving a test charge between two points inside a uniformly charged spherical shell is zero, no matter which path is chosen. Reason R : Electrostatic potential inside a uniformly charged spherical shell is constant and is same as that on the surface of the shell. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below (1) A is true but R is false (2) Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A (3) A is false but R is true (4) Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A Ans.  43. In a Young's double slit experiment, the source is white light. One of the slits is covered by red filter and another by a green filter. In this case (1) There shall be an interference pattern for red distinct from that for green. (2) There shall be no interference fringes. (3) There shall be alternate interference fringes of red and green. (4) There shall be an interference pattern, where each fringe's pattern center is green and outer edges is red. Ans. (2) Sol. Different colours will have different fringe width. Within a few fringes of red, there will be several fringes of violet. Also, there will be overlapping of colours. 44. questions.text: Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R Assertion A : Work done in moving a test charge between two points inside a uniformly charged spherical shell is zero, no matter which path is chosen. Reason R : Electrostatic potential inside a uniformly charged spherical shell is constant and is same as that on the surface of the shell. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below (1) A is true but R is false (2) Both A and R are true and R is the correct
questions.formattedText: Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R Assertion A : Work done in moving a test charge between two points inside a uniformly charged spherical shell is zero, no matter which path is chosen. Reason R : Electrostatic potential inside a uniformly charged spherical shell is constant and is same as that on the surface of the shell. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below (1) A is true but R is false (2) Both A and R are true and R is the correct
questions.latexText: Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R Assertion A : Work done in moving a test charge between two points inside a uniformly charged spherical shell is zero, no matter which path is chosen. Reason R : Electrostatic potential inside a uniformly charged spherical shell is constant and is same as that on the surface of the shell. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below (1) A is true but R is false (2) Both A and R are true and R is the correct

options.text: A is true but R is false
Both A and R are true and R is the correct

The value of Young's modulus of the wire as per this experiment is P \times 10^{11} Nm –2 , where the value of P is : (Take g = 3 \frac{m}{s}^{2} ) (1) 5 (2) 10 (3) 25 (4) 2.5\)

questions.text:
